intro: Telanthera pulchella, commonly known as the showy telanthera, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Telanthera pulchella is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display and easy maintenance.
